link.synopsis: This charming family comedy from television's golden age stars Betty White as Elizabeth, whose antics and foibles keep beleaguered but loving husband Alvin (Del Moore) on his toes. This vintage series is particularly notable for two reasons: A woman (White) was its co-creator, producer and star, and unlike the standard sitcom formula so common today, each episode features three unrelated vignettes, resulting in a nonlinear narrative.

link.synopsis: Conniving swindler Marvin Fleece (Dabney Coleman) steals millions as a televangelist superstar in this satirical comedy. The charismatic con man turns a dumpy TV station into a powerhouse studio with shows such as "Jump for Jesus," but when employees find out Fleece is a money-worshipping phony, judgment day arrives earlier than expected for the greedy preacher. Devo, Paul Reubens, Nancy Morgan, Roger E. Mosley and Marcia Wallace co-star.

link.synopsis: Feeling like outcasts in their own hometown, eccentric siblings Rikky (Nina Landis) and Pete (Stephen Kearney) set out to find a place more suitable to set down roots. They eventually land in a funky mining town, where Pete continues his quest to invent the ultimate gadget and country singer Rikky tries to find herself. But the brother and sister find that paradise is not so easily found in this quirky yet charming Australian comedy.

link.synopsis: Gloria Swanson stars as frumpy Beth Gordon, who loses her hubby to a sexy dame in director Cecil B. DeMille's comedy Why Change Your Wife, one of two silent films in this double bill. But Beth's ex is in for a big surprise when she glams up with an extreme makeover. Helmed by Cecil's brother William DeMille, the romantic drama Miss Lulu Bett stars Lois Wilson as a mistreated butterfly who emerges from her cocoon and ultimately finds happiness.

link.synopsis: After their successful collaboration on Koma, Iranian stars Arash Moayerian (who also directs) and Amin Hayayee share the spotlight once again in this romantic comedy. The bittersweet tale centers on two couples whose lives become entangled after a fateful encounter. Life takes a series of surprising turns for the foursome as they take a madcap journey with destiny as their guide. Leila Boushehri, Javad Razavian and Shaqayeq Farahani co-star.

link.synopsis: For as long as anyone can remember, competitive singer Eddie Bowman (Ken Weiler) has been the reigning king of karaoke at the local watering hole. But on one fateful evening, he faces a worthy adversary who just may usurp the throne. Can Eddie defend his crown and get the girl? Anil Kumar and Annie Meisels lead the supporting cast in this independent comedy from co-directors J.J. Ruscella and Dan Mackler.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this witty romantic comedy from first-time director Din S. Altit, Debbie Reynolds portrays frantic mother Shoshana Jacovski, a woman who's determined to help her son (Marty Belafsky) find the love of his life -- whether he wants her help or not. After all, one of her favorite questions is, "If you're not judging a book by its cover, then why are the best books unread?" Tempestt Bledsoe, Heather Juergensen and Guy Nardulli co-star.
link.title: synopsis
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Materialistic 20-something Tim Perroni (Brian Napolitan) tries to find a high-paying career while juggling six part-time jobs in this dark comedy. Addicted to his decadent lifestyle, Tim finally lands a full-time dream job but loses it in a day -- and ends up with 10 part-time jobs far worse than his previous punch-card positions. As pressure mounts to maintain his extravagant manner of living, Tim realizes he's headed for a miserable existence.

link.synopsis: After learning that one of his female colleagues is on the verge of being made a partner in the firm, an ambitious lawyer comes up with a brazen plan to advance his own career. Believing he has only one chance of climbing the legal ladder, he plays up the rumor that he's gay ... but how far is he willing to go to maintain the charade? John Antonini, Michael Ian Black and Julie Bowen star in this comedy of extremes from director Dave Diamond.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Greg Behrendt -- the best-selling author of the book that spawned the catch phrase "He's just not that into you" -- takes the stage at the San Jose Improv theater to try his hand at stand-up comedy. A former rock musician who's now a father living in the suburbs, Behrendt laments his waning coolness in segments such as "My Sexy Faces," "Tattoos for Daddy," "Playmate Playdate," "Chain Wallet" and "I Don't Understand My Robe."

link.synopsis: Set in San Francisco's Chinese community, director Wayne Wang's low-key comedy chronicles the changing relationship between widowed Mrs. Tam (Kim Chew) and her single, 30-year-old daughter, Geraldine (Laureen Chew). Believing she won't live to see another birthday, Mrs. Tam would like Geraldine -- who still lives at home -- to tie the knot soon. Is she reluctant to wed out of concern for her aging mother, or is it an aversion to tradition?
link.title: synopsis
A Thousand Years of Good Prayers
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family

link.synopsis: Tony Leung and Miriam Yeung play lovers once again in this popular romantic comedy, based on the best-selling illustrated novel by Jimmy Liao. Hoping to make a love connection, a meddling guardian angel pairs fast-talking hustler Ming (Leung) with Yeuk (Yeung), a charming blind woman, and causes Ming to suddenly lose his sight. As Yeuk teaches him to navigate a city he once knew so well, Ming realizes he's fallen for his tutor.
link.title: synopsis
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
Over the Rainbow, Under the Skirt

link.synopsis: Making his film debut in Giuseppe Bertolucci's touching comedy, Oscar-winner Roberto Benigni (Life Is Beautiful) stars as Mario Cioni, a dutiful son who must cater to his needy mother (Alida Valli). Mario's world revolves around his mama, and their bizarre relationship would keep Freud entertained for years. Can poor Mario break free from his mother's apron strings and live a normal life? Carlo Monni co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
My Brother Is an Only Child
Big Deal on Madonna Street: 20 Years Later
The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn
Open Letter to the Evening News

link.synopsis: A young widow named Susan (Debra Sweaney) must fend for herself when she falls into the clutches of a gang of drug smugglers lead by the menacing Mongo (Brian Oldfield). Once a mere working girl from the city, Susan transforms into a tough and resourceful female warrior who's more than a match for these lowlifes. Now, it's the gang's turn to worry as she seeks vengeance as "Macho Woman" in this campy action comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and Lies in Sin City
Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes
Forbidden Territory: Stanley's Search for Livingstone
Nothing Too Good for a Cowboy

link.synopsis: The angel Giordano (Krzysztof Globisz) -- the loveable hero from the hit comedy Angel in Krakow -- is back for this popular sequel that proves a man in love can actually be happier than an angel in heaven. After being fired by the Almighty and released to live on earth, Giordano has a hard time adjusting to life as a human being. But just when he's about to give up, a sympathetic God sets him up on a blind date.
link.title: synopsis
On the Banks of the Niemen
In Heaven as it is on Earth
One Week from a Man's Life

link.synopsis: Two social misfits vow to stay together in life and death in this quirky comedy swirling with dark undertones. Fate intervenes when despondent dancer Donald tries to kill himself: Instead of drowning, he winds up meeting his future wife, Dot (Eugenie Bondurant), a telephone psychic who keeps rats as pets. The two marry, but Dot's rats come between the couple, triggering a series of unfortunate events. John E. Parcher and Joe Ochman co-star.

link.synopsis: An ambitious teen risks everything to land a record contract in this lighthearted surf-and-sand comedy. Charlie Harrison (Philip Paley) wants more out of life besides checking out bikini-clad babes with his beach-going buddies: He wants to be a rock star. But when he aligns himself with the wrong people, Charlie's scheme to get the attention of a top producer results in chaos. Charles Gilleran, Heidi Helmer and Amanda Goodwin co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington / The Happy Hooker Goes Hollywood

link.synopsis: A group of Wall Street executives devise an outlandish scheme that will turn them into the power players of the financial world in this comedy. But pulling off the deal of the century won't be easy with a plan plagued by a twisted love affair between two bitter rivals (Peter Scolari and Mary Crosby), enormous egos, double-crossers -- and the boss's corpse. Chris Lemmon, Ken Kercheval and Lisa Moncure star.
link.title: synopsis
Jack of All Trades: The Complete Series
The Wonderful, Horrible Life of Leni Riefenstahl
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

link.synopsis: Living in the suburbs has never been so riveting, thanks to this pitch-black comedy from writer-director brothers Josh and Jeff Crook that premiered at the 2003 CineVegas Film Festival. When Freddy (Jason Madera) gets his boss's girlfriend (Christina Caparoula) pregnant, he blocks her from having an abortion by tying her up in the basement -- and trying to hide her from his unsuspecting wife (Angie Grant).

How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
What a Man Wants, What a Woman Needs
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Sensible cop Curry (Jacky Cheung) and his hotheaded partner, Pepper (Stephen Chow), try to catch a ruthless killer in this action-packed comedy. Despite their differences, the childhood pals wind up falling for the same woman (Ann Bridgewater), an attractive reporter who's helping to cast a new "Cops"-type reality show. But even the bright lights of Hollywood won't stop the two in their mission to bring down a desperate gunrunner (Blackie Ko).

God of Gamblers III: Back to Shanghai
The Legend of the Flying Swordsman
Once Upon a Time in China

link.synopsis: Borrowing its plot and title from the Jennifer Aniston-Jay Mohr vehicle Picture Perfect, this romantic Bollywood comedy finds a single working girl named Pooja (Kirti Reddy) trying to convince her curmudgeonly boss (Kader Khan) that she's engaged to a prominent artist (Abhishek Bachchan). The only trouble is, she's actually in love with her boss's son, Raj (Sanjay Suri) -- but, thanks to her lies, he thinks she's off-limits.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Burt Reynolds and D.L. Hughley star in this raucous comedy about the hottest beach volleyball team to hit the sand. Down on his luck, chronic ne'er-do-well Billy Cole (Reynolds) comes up with a surefire money-making scheme: a volleyball dream team composed of strippers. But Cole's in for a big surprise when the women decide to prove themselves as true athletes instead of sexy showpieces. Paul Rodriguez, Angie Everhart and Gabrielle Reece co-star.

The Original Latin Kings of Comedy

link.synopsis: After being stimulated by a screening of Bo Derek's 10, a group of lonely young Irishmen cook up a foolproof plan: They'll post an ad in the &NFi;Miami Herald&NFi_;, inviting American ladies to come to them. But when the town's womenfolk find out about it, they launch a counter-scheme to fend off foreign competition. Reminiscent of Waking Ned Devine, this quaint romantic comedy was produced by the minds behind The Full Monty.

link.synopsis: A camping trip results in some twisted family memories in this off-the-wall black comedy. Hoping for one last family vacation before his children leave the nest, laid-back dad Eric Bury (Frank Harper) takes his brood to a trailer park teeming with oddballs. The clan's plans for a relaxing holiday go down the drain as they encounter sex addicts, a sadistic cop (Michael Bowen), decapitated corpses, bloodthirsty fish and a sage (David Carradine).

link.synopsis: A single woman endures a series of losers as she searches for love in this entertaining comedy set in Los Angeles. Believing that time is running out for her to find a soul mate and get married, 35-year-old Taylor (Sarah Blevins) steps up her pursuit, only to find herself involved with some highly unstable men. Taylor and her friends begin to think they'll be single and miserable forever, but life is full of surprises.

link.synopsis: Love turns out to be the most dangerous enemy in this gangland story by Rokuro Mochizuki. Violence blends with romantic comedy in this thriller, which follows hit man Kinichi (Eiji Okuda), who sets out to whack the rival gang's boss but gets sidetracked by lovely waitress Yoko. Kinichi tries everything possible to win the object of his desire, abandoning the mission and leaving his inept partner in crime to pull off the all-important hit.

link.synopsis: The good news is that Joseph (Christopher M. Brown) has just inherited a boardinghouse. The bad news: It's awash in debt, and he needs to find tenants -- fast. So naturally, Joseph is delighted when Charlie (George Wendt), his wife (Shanna Reed) and their curvaceous daughter (Anastasia Sakelaris) drop in looking for a place to stay while they're on vacation … from another planet. Lev L. Spiro helmed this quirky sci-fi comedy.

link.synopsis: Living in a sleepy seaside New England town, 26-year-old Guy (David Garver) -- who's chronically unemployed and falling behind with his rent -- feels trapped by his environment. His life takes an unexpected turn, however, when Guy recruits his genial but dimwitted friend Carl (R.J. Reed) for a little thievery in director Marc Berlin's entertaining comedy. The film's supporting cast includes Ali Anderson and Elaina Vratos.

Anna Bergman, Felicity Devonshire and Peter Blake co-star.

link.synopsis: A much loved folk healer (Yossi Banai) in a small Israeli village takes on more than he can handle when he decides to marry off his reluctant daughter (Miri Aloni). The headstrong young woman consistently rejects her father's handpicked suitors, upping the ante in a dizzying game of matchmaking and matrimony. Is love in the cards for the unwilling bride-to-be? Joel Silberg directs this lively comedy that's heavy on the high jinks.

link.synopsis: First, serial beauty pageant contestant Love (Assunta da Rossi) discovers that her roommate has ties to her friend Yolly's ex-boyfriend. Then, she learns that she's the same woman who's been sleeping with her cousin Karen's man. But when she spots this girl canoodling with one of the pageant's judges, it's time to teach her a lesson in love. Joyce Jimenez and Ai-Ai de las Alas co-star in this comedy about friends and lovers.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this National Lampoon comedy of biblical proportions, there's no Garden of Eden, just a bustling university where Adam (Cameron Douglas), an aspiring singer-songwriter, meets the beautiful and talented Eve (Emmanuelle Chriqui). But despite her obvious sex appeal, Eve is miraculously still a virgin -- and plans to stay that way until she feels the time is right. Chad Lindberg, Jake Hoffman and Brian Klugman co-star.

National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: After his mom bears a new son, envious 9-year-old Tete (Biel Durán) finds himself longing for the comfort of his mother's breast, too, and beseeches the moon for a mammary all his own in this offbeat comedy. His prayer is answered in the form of French dancer Estrellita (Mathilda May) -- but Tete must compete with her husband (Gérard Darmon) and a lovesick teen (Miguel Poveda) for Estrellita's attentions.

link.synopsis: Director Jeff Oppenheim's romantic comedy stars Anthony Michael Hall as Josh, a bashful New York City street performer whose love life is in the doldrums. Always ready to help a friend in need, his womanizing pals Tim (Lord Jamar) and Sean (Ivan Martin) give Josh some pointers on the ins and outs of dating -- and an image makeover to boot. Meanwhile, Josh sets his sights on alluring waitress Doreen (Marlo Marron).

When French fashion designer Yves Malmaison (Richard Fancy) is poisoned and Chilly D finds himself in grave danger, a diminutive witch thinks she's doing them both a favor by shoving them into the same body. Trouble is, Chilly keeps bouncing between his true self and his flamboyant new alter ego.

Gilliam, who's now a British citizen, basks in the wonder of it all as he screens his favorite clips. Also included are a Gilliam biography and appearances by other Python geniuses.

link.synopsis: Directed by Jacques Becker and shot on location in France, this Cannes Film Festival Award-winning romantic comedy takes place in the postwar world of the Parisian working class. Hotheaded print shop foreman Antoine (Roger Pigaut) goes crazy over the incessant flirting of his salesclerk wife, Antoinette (Claire Maffei). But when he loses a winning lottery ticket worth a fortune, their marriage may be in even greater trouble.

link.synopsis: Set in London, this offbeat romantic comedy centers on jobless lesbian writer Marina (Lisa Gornick), who's suffering a personal crisis and begins to question her whole life after breaking up with her longtime girlfriend, Romy (Raquel Cassidy). While Marina bicycles around town searching for meaning, serendipitous encounters with friends, family, former flames and strangers help fuel her philosophical odyssey.

link.synopsis: Return to television's golden age with this collection of episodes from the anthology series "General Electric Theater," hosted by Ronald Reagan. The hugely popular show, which ran from 1953-62, treated viewers to a lively mix of comedy, drama, mystery and fantasy, and boasted an impressive roster of celebrity guests, including Natalie Wood, Jack Benny, Zsa Zsa Gabor, Charles Bronson, Joan Fontaine and Ricardo Montalban, to name a few.

After crashing his ship, the extraterrestrial embarks on an adventure that includes attacking cigarette machines, going to jail and performing miracles. Eventually, Phil's high-profile lifestyle catches the attention of a special agent, who sets out to kill the alien and his Christian rock band.

Alone except for 2 million clones of himself, he calls home for help only to learn that robots have invaded Earth. With nothing to lose, the intrepid astronaut tries to harness the power of the mysterious Quark Star to save his planet.

link.synopsis: After spending months trying to get over his ex-girlfriend Chloe (Denise Richards), Owen (David Krumholtz) finally finds love again with Nadine (Milla Jovovich). But when Chloe's plans to become an actress fall through, she comes crawling back -- and Owen must choose between her love and the real thing. link.synopsis: Helmed by Dutch director Alex van Warmerdam, this provocative offbeat comedy recounts the odyssey of a jaunty blue dress -- from its genesis to its fiery demise when it's cremated along with its final owner. As the frock changes hands, it has a grim effect on those who come into contact with it, including a psychotic fashion designer, a middle-aged matron, a bag lady and an unhinged stalker. Annet Malherbe and Ariane Schluter are among the cast.

link.synopsis: With an isolated farmhouse as a backdrop, this stylish black comedy chronicles the humorous consequences of a ménage à trois. The three-cornered liaison develops between ignorant schlub Brand (Alex van Warmerdam), his zaftig wife, Keet (Annet Malherbe), and Brand's shapely tutor, Lena (Ariane Schluter). Unable to bear children anymore, Keet manipulates Lena into becoming a surrogate, leading to a twisted game of lust, exploitation and … homicide.

But genuine sparks fly when official business calls her out of state and she meets handsome Navy hero Tommy Dooley (John Harvey). Martha Raye and Nat "King" Cole co-star.

link.synopsis: In this madcap romantic comedy, Karan (Shahid Kapoor) is bewitched by the stunning, mysterious Tanya (Rimi Sen). When she hightails it to Dubai, Karan commissions a handsome investigator named Rocky (Akshay Kumar) to track her. But the plan backfires when Rocky ends up falling for her. Meanwhile, Tanya's disabled friend Sanju (Suniel Shetty), who also has a soft spot for her, tries quashing Rocky's attempts at getting too close.

link.synopsis: Following the efforts of slick Hollywood producer Peter Dragon (Jay Mohr) to advance his foundering career, this short-lived and controversial comedy series was likely too close to the truth to survive. Relying on his three stated pillars of showbiz -- prostitution, nepotism and dishonesty -- Dragon's "ethics" make for an entertaining ride. Guest stars include Sandra Bullock, Salma Hayek, Keanu Reeves and Scott Wolf ("Party of Five").

But when Jacobo's estranged brother -- a happily married man -- visits, the competitive Jacobo tells his sibling that he and Marta are husband and wife. Pretending to have an intimate bond, the "couple" soon finds their lives radically altered.

Her old-school parents (Filip Rados and Vera Zima) -- mortified by their unwed daughter's condition -- set out to find her a suitable spouse, but she wants no part of their matchmaking. Enter party boy Scott (Jason Whyte), who wheedles his way into tagging along with the ladies in their vintage Volkswagen van. But there's more to their traveling companion than meets the eye in director Grant Lahood's raucous comedy.

When his frustration boils over, Max decides to cripple the competition -- literally. He finally gains the success he craves, along with a fantastic new girlfriend (Molly Parker). Looking to redeem himself, the demoralized detective quits the police force and takes it upon himself to go after a band of terrorists threatening to blow up Hong Kong schools unless the government frees their leader.

link.synopsis: At the close of World War II, German factory worker Kalle Bluecher (Erwin Geschonneck) sets out for Wittenberge for the supplies to reopen his destroyed Dresden plant. Reaching his destination is simple enough, but how to bring back seven barrels of contraband carbide? He must skirt both American and Russian soldiers, as well as an assortment of war-shocked characters in this fast-paced comedy from director Frank Beyer.

link.synopsis: In this feature-length comedy film, funnyman Johnny Biscuit shows off his comic chops as he trains his crosshairs on Mormon culture. Bringing his scorching brand of humor and insight to the spotlight, he pokes fun at everything from the religion's idiosyncrasies to handicrafts. Biscuit's routine contains more uproarious moments than you'd imagine from a Mormon comic, but as he says, " I take my job as an executive smarty-pants seriously."

link.synopsis: In this lighthearted romantic comedy, Mormon comedian Jonathan (Will Swenson) finds himself at a crossroads after his wife dumps him. Spiritually disillusioned in the wake of his divorce, Jonathan leaves the fold but changes his tune when he meets Cammie Giles (Connie Young), the local flock's singles activities director. Helmed by Kurt Hale, the film features cameos by quarterback Steve Young and cager Danny Ainge.

link.synopsis: Combining three classic episodes from the Emmy-winning television series, this collection offers renowned Bishop Fulton Sheen's witty insights on Irish culture and humor. In "Psychology of the Irish," he discusses the qualities that make a person Irish. In "The Divine Sense of Humor," Sheen delves into God's sense of humor. And finally, in "Why Do People Laugh?" the bishop explores comedy and its important role in a healthy person's life.

link.synopsis: The modern Jamaican woman faces a dilemma: whether to choose a man who can fulfill her intimate desires or one who can satisfy her financial needs. Of course, the third option involves culling the best of both worlds -- two men -- and embracing a complicated lifestyle of perfect timing and continual deception. Presenting a scenario that leads to hilarious consequences, this comedy asks the question: Can you have your cake and eat it, too?

link.synopsis: Advertising executive Sanjay (Aftab Shivdasani) reaps the consequences of his womanizing when one of his many girlfriends finds out he's cheating and kills him in a fit of rage. But the gods give him another chance by reincarnating him as Sanjana (Antara Mali), Sanjay's long-lost sister! In his new feminine form, he finally understands what it's like to be a woman -- and what dogs men can be -- in this gender-bending Bollywood comedy.

link.synopsis: Determined to get his academic life back on track, Emilio (Borja Elgea) takes up residence in a quiet coastal cottage and vows to keep his nose to the grindstone. But when the perfect distraction arrives in the form of the beautiful Patricia (Paula Echevarria), Emilio learns an important lesson about setting unrealistic goals. Roger Pera and Jorge Sanz co-star in this charming Spanish comedy, written and directed by Ernesto Martin.

link.synopsis: Set in New Orleans, this engaging comedy finds comic duo Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy donning zoot suits to play a two-man traveling jazz band who unwittingly teams with affable chiseler Chester Wright (Bob Bailey). Along the way, they make the acquaintance of pretty Susan Cowan (Vivian Blaine), whose mother has lost her savings to real-estate swindlers. Can Stan, Ollie and Chester outfox the scammers and recoup Mrs. Cowan's cash?

link.synopsis: This vintage Mexican comedy series from the 1980s follows a group of teens who are trying to get through high school. In addition to the usual trials and traumas of adolescence, they have to contend with the wrath of their nasty principal (Martha Zabaleta) -- a woman who's been dubbed "Godzilla." An enormous hit throughout the Spanish-speaking world, the show set the stage for future Hispanic television sitcoms.

In the meantime, Othar and Dewey try to get their latest batch of hooch to Memphis ahead of the competition. Watch for Jaclyn Smith in a small role before "Charlie's Angels" made her a superstar.

link.synopsis: Peter (Joshua Schaefer) is a socially inept teen madly in love with his sexy next-door neighbor, Erica (Keri Russell). In a desperate attempt to get a date with her, he camps out on her front lawn for the entire summer. His parents think he's nuts, and his buddy Matt (R.D. Robb) thinks he should have sex with fruit. But Peter's goofy stunt gives him a new outlook on life, love and his neighbors in this quirky romantic comedy from Michael Davis.

link.synopsis: Chance (Thomas Hendrix) works at a fish hatchery and, in his downtime, moonlights as a toxic waste cleaner. But what he really wants to be is a champion stock car driver behind the wheel of a souped-up Camaro. Will Chance ever get the, well, chance, to live his dream? This quirky slacker comedy boasts an extensive soundtrack featuring Beck (the film was the inspiration for his hit song "Loser"), and look for artist Ed Ruscha as a "surf bassist."

So says comedian Jeff Cesario in this hilarious stand-up act featuring some of his most peace-disturbing material to date. In the span of just one hour, Cesario (an Emmy Award-winning comedy writer for the cable programs "Dennis Miller Live" and "The Larry Sanders Show") manages to touch on just about every topic imaginable, from lesbians to leaf blowers ... to his own quirky marriage.

link.synopsis: Between keeping a torrid affair with his sexy secretary a secret from his wife and keeping peace between his mother and mother-in-law, Armando (Fernando Allende), a fast-talking radio disc jockey, already has his hands full.
